TextLibrary.Text: Queen Gwendholyn
What can I do for you, your Majesty?
What can I do for you, your Majesty?
What can I do for you, your Majesty?
What can I do for you, your Majesty?

I have just received a message from a Dwarf named Khalkus. He is trying to get a caravan of supplies through our lands and across the mountains to Dhun-Kor, but he is worried that he will be attacked.

I have just received a message from a Dwarf named Khalkus. He is trying to get a caravan of supplies through our lands and across the mountains to Dhun-Kor, but he is worried that he will be attacked.

With all respect, your Majesty, don't we have enough troubles of our own without helping the Dwarves?
With all respect, your Majesty, don't we have enough troubles of our own without helping the Dwarves?
With all respect, your Majesty, don't we have enough troubles of our own without helping the Dwarves?
With all respect, your Majesty, don't we have enough troubles of our own without helping the Dwarves?
The Dwarves have been loyal allies of ours for many years. Now is not the time to turn our backs on friends.

As you wish. Where can I find this Dwarf?

He is waiting for you in the Hammer Pass to the north.
